page.title: 11SHOPS
page.content: {1915 They did their shopping in Hindon. If they wanted to go to Tisbury, they had to walk. There was a carrier's service that went to Salisbury on Tuesday and Saturday. He went early in the morning and came back late at night with his horse and cart. He would buy things for people and bring them back. He delivered papers round villages. {1925 There were 2 bakers in Hindon who baked in their shops. If you took your Christmas cake to them they would bake it for a penny. There was a butcher. {1945 They shopped in Hindon. There were 7 shops including a baker who baked in his shop, a butcher, a sweet shop, a watch repairer and a shoe mender. The shops started closing down in 1955.
